data.description:
Save our solar system in this full 360° retro inspired arcade action game. Protect all planets from alien invaders by controlling drones that are networked into an autonomous defense system. As you progress more planets come under attack, so you'll have to be wise to outmanoeuvre these cunning extraterrestrials who look to extinguish all life and resources in this galaxy.

Using your gaze to navigate this network of machines, supplant the threat on each planet before it reaches critical mass. The drone controls are dead simple – don your headgear and the head position tracking takes over – they shoot where you look.

With each unlocked planet comes with it its own weapon design to defend it against the UFOs. The more attack waves you fend off the better the chances to upgrade each drone with more stronger firepower and more shield damage. This will become imperative as you travel further to the edges of this solar system.

changelog.change_log: Crash fix for GearVR versions of the game due to recent Oculus Home update conflicting with Unreal Engine games.
Unreal Engine version upgrade: Improved Visuals!
Fixed Oculus Go splashscreen sticking bug

Fix:
* Motion Controller fix for bug introduced in the last version update

Improvements:

* Using shader caching to eliminate first time hitching when the very first UFO is spawned.
 
* Engine version upgrade with minor performance improvements.

Added 3D audio!! Be sure to wear headphones ;) Additionally some minor tweaks. 
Previous version added GearVR Controller Support

CRASH FIXED! 
The crash experienced by some uses on S7 devices has been fixed! 
For anyone that previously had this problem thank your for your patience and enjoy the game!

Huge thanks to Chris Babcock of Epic Games for helping us narrow down where the problem was.

NEW: Space dust particles kept 'ingame' for extra immersion and space feeling .
FIX: Back button now no longer causes a crash when returning to the game.


Note: This build may potentially fix the issue experienced by some users with a S7 Edge however as it is not reproducible on our S7 Edge we cannot say for sure - so please help us out and if you experience any technical problems, before leaving a bad review, please contact: support@headgear.io and include your Model Number (Settings - About device - Model number) so we can find a fix!
